definition: dimension (loanword, from Japanese)
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
three-dimensional/the real world (cf. 二次元[er4 ci4 yuan2])
two-dimensional/the fictional worlds of anime, comics and games

sentences.english: Dimension is always shaped by non-dimension.
sentences.chinese: 次元經常被非次元所塑造。

sentences.english: The crystal extractors from that dimension cross through all dimensions.
sentences.chinese: 從那個次元的水晶提取器穿越所有的次元。

sentences.english: In three dimensions. you see the double helix.
sentences.chinese: 在三維次元裏，你看到雙螺旋。

definition: three-dimensional/the real world (cf. 二次元[er4 ci4 yuan2])
two-dimensional/the fictional worlds of anime, comics and games
cartoons and comics/animes and mangas/cartoon (animated movie)/anime
plane (of existence)
time and place/world of a particular locale and era/(physics) space-time
otaku, a Japanese term for people with obsessive interests such as anime, manga, and video games/see also 宅男[zhai2 nan2]/see also 宅女[zhai2 nu:3]
universe/cosmos
worm-hole (in cosmology and science fiction)
crash/breakdown (of social values etc)/burst/to crumble/to collapse
caricature/cartoon/Japanese manga
Chinese comics
four-dimensional space (math.)
animation/cartoon
garage kit/action figure/model figure
voice actor (loanword from Japanese 声優 seiyū)
puppet/figure
